CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Aegis Corp relative to Starlight Innovations?
SRP.A: Aegis Corp is {above} Starlight Innovations in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Starlight Innovations relative to Aegis Corp?
SRP.A: Starlight Innovations is {below} Aegis Corp in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total market share?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Starlight Innovations}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total market share?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Aegis Corp}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Starlight Innovations's minimum Market Share in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Starlight Innovations's minimum Market Share is in {2001}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Aegis Corp's maximum Market Share in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Aegis Corp's maximum Market Share is in {1985}.

NC.Q: Between 1995 and 2001, was the average total Market Share higher or lower than between 1995 and 1996?
NC.A: The average total market share between 1995 and 2001 was {lower} than between 1995 and 1996.

NC.Q: Was the total Market Share in 1995 higher or lower than in 2003?
NC.A: The total market share in 1995 was {higher} than in 2003.

NC.Q: Was the total Market Share in 2008 higher or lower than in 2010?
NC.A: The total market share in 2008 was {about the same} than in 2010.

NC.Q: Was the total Market Share in 1984 higher or lower than in 2002?
NC.A: The total market share in 1984 was {higher} than in 2002.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Starlight Innovations} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Starlight Innovations and Aegis Corp first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Starlight Innovations and Aegis Corp first exchanged leading positions in {1987}.
